intro: Tauschia seatonii, commonly known as the Seaton's tauschia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Tauschia seatonii is often found in open habitats such as coastal cliffs and sandy soils.
